meaningMnemonic: You see a <radical>flag</radical> near the <radical>exit</radical>, so you use your <radical>fingers</radical> to <kanji>dig</kanji> there. Most flags mark something, and this exit is pretty obvious, so there must be something under here. At least that's what you think to yourself as you dig.
readingMnemonic: You <kanji>dig</kanji> until you finally hit something. It's a bunch of buried old <reading>coots</reading> (くつ). They're in an underground room for old coots. One yells up at you, "Whatcha doing to our roof, ya whipper snapper?! Stop digging in our lawn!"
